page.title: 10CARNIVAL IN CHAPEL-FRITH
page.content: Foresters in the ancient Royal Forest of the High Peak purchased land about l225 & obtained permission to build a 'chapel'in the forest.The church was dedicated to the martyred Thomas Becket & the present building stands on the site of the original chapel.The founding date-July 7th-became the medieval fair & later l9th century "Wakes".Local industry took its holidays at this time & shops were shut for a week while townspeople took their annual holiday. Now,the carnival is held on the Saturday nearest July 7th & the whole town is involved.A grand procession passes through decorated streets & events continue for a week.In l985 the visit of the carnival queen to the parish church co-incides with the 760th anniversary of the founding-July 7th.
